thread.title: Top White House cybersecurity adviser steps down
thread.title_full: Top White House cybersecurity adviser steps down

title: Top White House cybersecurity adviser steps down
text:
02 Top White House cybersecurity adviser steps down 
Federal Times: One of the president's top cybersecurity advisers, Ari Schwartz, stepped down from his position on the National Security Council on Sept. 30, ending a two-year tour at the White House.Schwartz came to the White House in 2013 as the administration's director for cybersecurity privacy, civil liberties and policy and transitioned to the NSC senior director for cybersecurity policy role in March 2014.
